main event: Several bright green objects with long tails were seen moving rapidly across the sky over the Ohio-Indiana area on January 3, 1962.
interesting points: The objects were viewed by both military and civilian observers.
The sightings occurred over a period of 1-2 minutes, with durations ranging from 1-6 seconds.
The witnesses described the objects as being very bright and fiery in appearance.
One sighting was reported by a USAF T-33 pilot at an altitude of 20,000 feet.
The sightings were believed to be related to the Quadrantids meteor shower that was occurring at the time.
result: The sightings were likely due to meteor activity.
sighted object: Bright green objects with long tails
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
